intro: Cryptolepis gillettii, commonly known as the African moonseed, is a flowering plant native to tropical Africa. It belongs to the family Menispermaceae and is characterized by its compound leaves and clusters of small, greenish-yellow flowers. The plant produces elongated, cylindrical fruits that contain several seeds. It is often found in moist, wooded areas and is valued for its medicinal properties in traditional herbal medicine. Its botanical features make it an important species in both ecological and pharmacological studies.
